description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). 17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with chain and laid lines visible (frame-ruled). On fol. 188a-b: Verses of poetry. Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals. Several inscriptions, including ownership statements on fol. 1a. Mildewed. Copy completed on Yawm al-thulathā 28 Jumādá al-Awwal 889 (colophon, fol. 187b). Incipit: قال العبد الفقير ... محمد بن حسن بن علي النواجى الشافعى ... اما بعد حمد الله الذي خلق الانسان فى احسن تقويم ... فقد سالني بعض الاخوان ان اجمع له نبذة فى الحسان من الغلمان Explicit: لو لم تكن روضة للحسن او فلكا ما كان جمع فيك الغصن والقمر لكان هذا ابلغ فى المعنا وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل

binding_note: Dark brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower cover, fore-edge flap and envelope-flap. Both covers have an elaborate blind-tooled panel, with a central mandorla with two pendants on the vertical axis. Vertical fillets link the central mandorla to an outer frame made of fillets, with a s-shape running pattern and a small floral stamp in the corners. Paper pastedowns.
